item.title: Mastering presence: the quest for reliable presence awareness in Home Assistant
item.description: One of the main points of a truly smart home is how much it is aware of itself and the things within and around. For I to consider a home to be smart, or even automated, it must do stuff by itself, not because you are giving it commands. If all it does is react to commands, then it’s an RC (remote-controlled) home (yes, like toy cars), and that’s cool too (but not as cool). I go for an almost sentient state vibe, more like a J.A.R.V.I.S (although Skynet is a risk).
